para.text: Implemented. Currently only the first two columns are filled.
Implemented. ASC() operates on the current system codepage. Any codepage definition in the Config.FPW file is currently ignored.
Strings with more than 16 MB are supported.
Strings with more than 16 MB are supported.
Implemented. CHR() uses the current codepage ignoring any custom code page specification in the Config.FPW file.
Implemented for native classes. COM objects cannot be instantiated. Additional parameters are not supported.
You can load .NET objects that have been made available by SET CLASSLIB TO.
Implemented for field, variable and property access. Calculations can not yet be performed.
Supports file names with an exclamation mark.
On Unix based systems the file name is case-sensitive.

Files with more than 16 MB are supported. On Unix based systems the file name is case-sensitive. Files with a byte-order mark or a UTF-8 flag are recognized as Unicode file when Unicode support is enabled. See SYS(8000).
Supports file names with an exclamation mark.
Implemented. The syntax with two parameters is not supported.
Strings with more than 16 MB are supported.
Strings with more than 16 MB are supported.
Strings with more than 16 MB are supported.
Strings with more than 16 MB are supported.
Implemented for native classes. COM objects cannot be instantiated. Additional parameters are not supported.
PARAMETERS() behaves like PCOUNT() and is not reset for other calls.
Guineu uses a different algorithm to generate random numbers.
Strings with more than 16 MB are supported.
Strings with more than 16 MB are supported.
On Mono platforms the resolution of SECONDS() is approximately 50 ms.
Implemented. Currently the last parameter with the index tag is ignored.
Strings with more than 16 MB are supported.
Implemented for queries that return a single result set. SQLSETPROP() is ignored. Queries are always executed synchronously. AERROR() isn't updated.
Implemented. Not all errors are handled. AERROR() is not set. SQLSETPROP() settings are ignored.
Strings with more than 16 MB are supported.
Implemented. The lAdditive/nFlag parameter is currently ignored.

On Unix based systems, the file name is case-sensitive. Supports Strings with more than 16 MB. In Unicode mode the file is written with UTF-8 encoding and no byte order mark. See SYS(8000) for details.
Supports strings with more than 16 MB.
Implemented. Only "@0" is currently supported as a format code. Numeric values ignore SET("DECIMALS").
Supports strings with more than 16 MB.
Guineu uses version number 09.10 instead of 09.00.
